posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hello!
We all know that Rangers must wear light- or no armor for their Dual-wield feat to work. So if you want a dual-wielder in heavy armor, you have to pick the TWF and Ambidexterity feats.
But what about ITWF? Will the ITWF feat that Rangers get at lvl 9 only work in light armor as well?
I tested it in the "Pretty good character creator" module with this build:
SpoilerRanger(9), Fighter(4), Human STR: 15 (18) CON: 12 INT: 12 01: Ranger(1): Power Attack, Cleave, Favored Enemy, { 02: Fighter(1): Weapon Focus: Shordsword




Improved Two-Weapon Fighting
I equipped the ranger with full plate and two shortswords and let it attack some combat dummies. It has BAB 13 and should have 3 attacks per round when fighting with one weapon. Two weapons should add a forth attack and ITWF should add a fifth attack.
The combat log showed 5 attacks per round. The AB was -2 compared with one hand attacks. There were 2 off hand attacks per round at the right AB.
This test showed that the ITWF feat you get from the Ranger class worked just like the normal ITWF feat even in heavy armor.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Mick

This is a brilliant observation you have made. Congratulations!

It opens up many more possibilities for strength based dual wielding ranger builds, where large amounts of ranger levels are highly desirable for the favored enemies feats

I read your post and tested it as well in the Pretty Good Character Creator and I wish to make it known I have confirmed Mick's observation. 

First with a Fighter 1 / Ranger 9 build using the method of taking the TWF and Ambidexterity feats as a fighter, then leveling ranger to 9. 

BAB 10. Two shortswords wearing full plate. 4 attacks when it should be 3 if the ranger ITWF feat was restricted to light armor.

Also with a Fighter 1 / Ranger 19 build. BAB 20. Two shortswords wearing full plate. 6 attacks when it should be 5 if the ranger ITWF feat was restricted to light armor.

It shows in the character sheet display, and the combat log as well.
